hook.text: Scientists are developing contraceptives that last longer, have fewer side effects, and work for all genders.

buildup.text: Research includes non-hormonal pills, gene-based approaches, and injectable gels lasting over a year.

discovery.text: A non-hormonal male pill that blocks a protein needed for sperm function showed promise in early trials.

twist.text: Despite decades of research, no male pill has reached the market yet. Funding and interest lag behind.

climax.text: The next generation of contraceptives could finally offer true equality in reproductive responsibility.

punchline.text: Better methods are coming. For everyone.
